page.title: 16RELIGION:GOULCEBY-SCAMBLESBY
page.content: There have been 5 churches,at least 4 Methodist chapels & 1 early Baptist chapel.There are now 4 churches,one seldom used,and 1 chapel;the only resident clergyman,a non-stipendiary curate.Some Catholics worship in nearby towns.The chapel and 2 churches have a regular Sunday service.There is growing collaboration between Angli- cans & Methodists and joint services in Scamblesby.{About 8% of the people} {worship regularly.About twice this {come occasionally on ordinary Sundays. Popular occasions with larger numbers are Harvest,Carols,Songs of Praise etc {Anglican }congregations are elderly + younger incomers.{Methodists }are more indigenous.The notable occasion of the year is at {Red Hill}on Good Friday;an {"Act of Witness",}a pilgrimage for about 500 people-many from far affield
